page.title: 07PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: St. Laurence at Middleton-One-Row was built in 1870/1 as a Chapel of Ease to the ancient Parish Church of St. George, due to the movement of village development. Both churches are under the care of the same Vicar. Three services are celebrated each Sunday and one evensong each month at St. George. The approximate collective congregation each Sunday is between 60 and 100. The Electoral Roll in 1985 is 126. The Methodist Chapel built in 1856 is closing after the Harvest Festival service on Sunday, October 13th 1985 due to falling congregations. The congregation will attend services at Middleton St.George.
